fi.lrkr.twos.game

Class Logic

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.lrkr.twos.game.Logic

  • public class Logic
extends Object
    Class provides the core functionality of the game.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Logic()
      Constructor for default Logic object values.
      Logic(int height, int width, int start)
      Constructor for creating Logic object which manages the game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkIfMoveHappened(int[][] boardValuesBeforeMove, int[][] boardValuesAfterMove)
      Checks if move happened after it was executed by checking if any Piece moved.
      boolean checkLoss()
      Checks if the game is lost by checking if there are any possible moves left.
      void executeCommand(char c)
      Executes a game command, checks if move happened and if it resulted in a loss.
      Board getBoard() 
      int getHighScore() 
      int getMoves() 
      int getScore() 
      void restart()
      Method restarts the game after a loss if the player decided not to stop playing.
      void setGui(Gui gui) 
      void start()
      Method starts the game by first reading saved high score (if available), then initializing the Board to pieces with 0 values and finally adding the first piece on a random location.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Logic

        public Logic()
        Constructor for default Logic object values.

      • Logic

        public Logic(int height,
             int width,
             int start)
        Constructor for creating Logic object which manages the game. Also creates the Board for playing.
        Parameters:
        height - Board's height
        width - Board's width
        start - Pieces' starting value

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Method starts the game by first reading saved high score (if available), then initializing the Board to pieces with 0 values and finally adding the first piece on a random location.

      • restart

        public void restart()
        Method restarts the game after a loss if the player decided not to stop playing. Resets moves and score. Reinitializes the Board to pieces with 0 value and adds a new piece at random location.

      • executeCommand

        public void executeCommand(char c)
        Executes a game command, checks if move happened and if it resulted in a loss.
        Parameters:
        c - Char representing the command

      • checkIfMoveHappened

        public boolean checkIfMoveHappened(int[][] boardValuesBeforeMove,
                                   int[][] boardValuesAfterMove)
        Checks if move happened after it was executed by checking if any Piece moved.
        Parameters:
        boardValuesBeforeMove - 2d array of Board's Pieces' values before move
        boardValuesAfterMove - 2d array of Board's Pieces' values after move
        Returns:
        True if at least one Piece moved, false otherwise

      • checkLoss

        public boolean checkLoss()
        Checks if the game is lost by checking if there are any possible moves left.
        Returns:
        false if there are possible moves, true if not (lost game)

      • getBoard

        public Board getBoard()

      • setGui

        public void setGui(Gui gui)

      • getScore

        public int getScore()

      • getHighScore

        public int getHighScore()

      • getMoves

        public int getMoves()
